intro: Swertia phragmitiphylla, commonly known as the reed leaf swertia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and India. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, typically arranged in raceme-like clusters. Swertia phragmitiphylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and medicinal research.
